Reviews.Title: “Expected Basice But Could Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: Lauren T
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES: Staff friendly, location great, room adequate, hot water, towels, cleanISH. CHEAP Negatives: Crayon and pencil on room walls, bathroom was tiny and if you were a bigger person you would have trouble getting in and out of the shower, on the bottom floor so had no view out of window and a lot of noise, bed hard and uncomfortable, heating on when and it was far too stuffy and finally the breakfast while nice it took 15 minutes to bring us warm croissants, my cup and saucer were filthy and when i asked for a clean one the waitress (who didn't speak english) took it with no apology and took 5 minutes to fetch me a clean one!! When we left our room we noticed a waitress sat on the kitchen side that they use to prepare the toast etc. I wouldn't go here again unless some changes were made.

Reviews.Title: “Good no-frills short-stopover option, close to Victoria”
Reviews.Author: senti2comun
Reviews.Content: People are complaining about room size, etc etc - but in London, hotels are an expensive rip-off period - for a tiny room with basic TV channels (hopefully this will have to change after the digital switchover). In terms of looking at this hotel compared to others I have stayed in for the same price range, its fine. The rooms are actually quite big compared to some in Bloomsbury, free wifi, decent bathroom... You can pay quite a bit more and stay in the Comfort Inn down the road, but you might not get so much more for your money (although CI is a good choice too). I was on the top floor - be warned, there is no lift!!! But at least the rooms upstairs are probably quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Location is key...the rest was bare necessities.”
Reviews.Author: world t
Reviews.Content: I am having a tough time choosing the right words to describe this. I guess, if you are from the US and are used to space, free toiletries, a big breakfast, cable channels on your tv even from the cheapest hotels, this might disappoint. I stayed there one night and it provided me with the essentials to get through the night, but absolutely nothing more. Very cramped, only one person can fit in the stairway at one time, but I get the impression that this is the case with all the hotels on that side of the city. These are older townhouses that were made into hotels. The breakfast was hot croissants, coffee...quite nice, but the dining room was tiny as the rest of the building. The staff was nice, they let me leave my luggage there before check in and after. All in all, it was ok but nothing to rave about.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel for your short stay”
Reviews.Author: AlinaLiu
Reviews.Content: All boys at receptionist were very friendly and tried to help us with all our questions, even they didn't knew the answer. We had a room in -1 floor, next to the dining room. It was a bit noisy, because early in the morning we heard people who prepared breakfast walking. Breakfast was great. We could choose between toasts and croasants. Croasants were really great! Towels were changed daily. We chose this hotel, because it is in really quiet street, but not very far from attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Trip half ruined!”
Reviews.Author: maojia
Reviews.Content: This hotel...was the worst choice we made in the entire trip! I give 2 stars, because the staff was friendly and helpful, and the location is relatively convenient. But never again! The double room was pretty rundown, with wallpaper half tore, the worst part of all was there was dark stain on the sheet (suspect to be dry blood)...We paid 69 pounds/night, it's cheap, but come on, for a self-claimed 3 star hotel? I thought they could do better than that!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but too pricey for the size”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveller83
Reviews.Content: The hotel is everything one would expect from a budget hotel - except the cost. We chose the hotel because of its location and it didnt disappoint. However for the price we paid per night the double room was really tiny, the breakfast provided was meagre and the shower heads and floors were not that clean. We initially got room number 1 (downstairs) and the wifi didnt work, we were told to stand in the corridor and use it because there was nothing they could do. That being said its conveniently located between the Victoria and Pimlico stations - a direct line to London Kings Cross. Walking distance to most of the attractions and some good bars in the area. No room service. Ask for a room upstairs if you want any wifi connection. They can only keep a few bags and if you come down late (like we did) your bag waits in the corridor for you. Some of the staff were helpful (one helped us change rooms). Its a quiet hotel - we didnt hear too much noise while sleeping. The rooms are quite tiny for 2 adults, with suitcase - you spend abit of time navigating around each other. If you just want a convenient place to sleep, change and leave your bags then I would recommend the hotel but I doubt I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable beds but very creaky floors”
Reviews.Author: Misuba
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights 22-24 December. Paid Â£119 for a twin room with en-suite, which works out Â£29.75 per person. Cheap! Pre-payment for first night, and on arrival paid remaining by cash. On arrival, very smooth transaction, and easy check-in. We were given a room on 3rd floor. I already knew from reviews that no lift was provided, but stairs were quite uneven to carry my suitcase. Pictures are a bit misleading because the room in actuality was a lot smaller than the pictures you see on their website. Room temperature was perfect, warm and toasy. but it got quite cold at one point in night. I was very impressed at how CLEAN the room and bathroom was. Beds were the most comfortable beds I've slept in. Bathroom was basic and shower's water temperature was just right, however a bit slow to drain. Didnt like the back view. And the floors were incredibly creaky and squeaky. which made me feel awkward to move around. Worse - could hear people moving above, hence creaky ceilings. Its a good job I was out for most of the day. When you go out, you have to leave key with owner and on return just tell them your room number. Breakfast - is in the basement, not a problem but again, pictures are misleading because this breakfast room was very very small. It had about 3 double tables and 3 single tables as the hotel has 22 rooms. We came a bit later on 2nd night - and it was more busy. Was served by a curteous European woman - who offered the best hot croissants I've had. Breakfast was very basic but was sufficient enough. Location - great, took me 12 minutes to walk to victoria tube station and about 9 minutes to the coach station. Neighbourhood is lovely, very quiet and I felt safe walking at night with my sister. Owners - very polite and pleasant. On check-out, they looked after our luggage for whole day whilst we did further sight seeing. Overall - be prepared to drag your luggage up uneven stairs. Don't expect to be provided with toiletries. The twin room is very small. Learn to live out of your suitcase, although they provide you with a storage cupboard. I may choose another hotel in victoria next time, but I know I won't get a cheap price like this.

Reviews.Title: “nice from the outside...”
Reviews.Author: Julian F
Reviews.Content: ...but inside crap: lousy carpets, noisy, very small rooms, breakfast room tiny and breakfast simple and of basic style, warm water system did not work upon my stay (no compensation for that!), location itself okay (easy walk to Buckingham Palace, Westminster, London Eye,...) - also the price is comparably cheap but still too high for that bad service

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leo_meira
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at Victor Hotel, one couple. It's a good hotel for who don't wanna stay much time in the room (to met the city!).. Nice bathroom/shower, bed ok, room with facilities, efficient breakfast, helpfully frontdesk. It's very central, some pubs around, near the Victoria Station and Pimlico Station. We had a great time there!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: leonardherman
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights total over the course of 10 days and found this to be an excellent base from which to explore London. It is a ten minute walk to Victoria station, about ten to the Thames and has pubs, restaurants, groceries and laundrette less than two minutes walk. The WIFI was good and they serve a nice breakfast of juice, coffee, tea, cereals, fruit, toast and croissants. The staff were friendly and answered any questions we had. There is no air conditioning or elevator, but it is clean, comfortable and reasonably priced. If you want to be pampered or waited on, look elsewhere, but if need practical accommodation while visiting London this is it.

Reviews.Title: “small but cozy”
Reviews.Author: Miguel D
Reviews.Content: Very central location about 800 meters from Victoria station. Small hotel with small rooms but very clean, well equipped and the staff attentive. Small breakfast room with good food but it is advisable to have breakfast early.

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back again”
Reviews.Author: Hungary_Peace
Reviews.Content: The hotel interior is very old and it has a stank smell. The receptionist is friendly but one of the night staff was a bit rude to us when we mentioned that the window ledge was broken. He was being really sarcastic and asked what do we want him to do about it and is there a problem if the window is broken. We are not very impressed with the breakfast service too as it was a very small dining area. You literally have to queue up and wait fo other people to finish their free breakfast then you can walk in and get a table. It is a very typical small london hotel so we cannot really expect much. The only reason we book into this hotel because it was close to the coach station that brings us to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Well located, very clean but a little bit pricey for a basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoPad
Reviews.Content: Location: perfect. Five-minute walk from Victoria station, on a quiet and safe street. Cleanliness: perfect. The room and bathroom were perfectly cleaned every day, towels changed, all tidied up. Staff: kind. Room 8: the smallest double room I've ever stayed in, with the bed attached to the wall and curtains, and a small bathroom as well. Our view from the window was on internal walls. Breakfast was fine: breakfast cereals to choose from, orange juice, a selection of jams and coffee/tea, toasts/croissants, but the room where they served it was too small, and we had to wait 20 minutes to have a table. On the whole, we had a good stay and our first priority - cleanliness - was fully satisfied, but it should cost less to be good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “great location at a good price.”
Reviews.Author: hairaiser007
Reviews.Content: found the hotel reception staff very helpfull and polite, had a triple room downstairs.was very quiet,nice room bed not to my liking too hard. the location is great not far from anywhere in central london. breakfast very basic cereal, tea,coffee,juice,toast,and fruit. would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny tiny cozy room - perfect for me.”
Reviews.Author: TortolaTanya
Reviews.Content: I had to move out of the hotel I was in, Victoria Best Western, for the Saturday night before my departure, because I had only booked through Friday, then my travel plans changed. Hotel Victor was one of the few that had a room available, and it was just down the street from the Best Western. Other people did not give it great reviews, but I figured it was just for one night. The front desk staff were great, very attentive, and one of them carried my bag up for me, so I didn't care that there wasn't an elevator. This was probably the teeniest hotel room I've ever stayed in, but it was just me so I wasn't bumping into anyone - also I had requested single category, so I think it was a single room. It had a double bed, vanity at end of bed (like you sit on the bed to type on your computer), a wardrobe, a fully adequate bathroom with tons of hot water (the shower was a little skinny for a big gal like me, 5'8", 180 pounds, but I should think fine for smaller people), an entryway where I stashed my luggage, and nice window onto the street which did not have a lot of noise. Other people complained about the breakfast, because it was not "hot". Again, I found it adequate. Yes, there was a table with the cold cereals, yogurts, and fruits, and juice. The waitresses will bring you hot croissants/toast, and coffee/tea. This seems to be the trend in the small London hotels now...more money paid for staff service, rather than the food. The croissants were piping hot, and served nicely. The breakfast room is in the basement - again, seems to be the trend - but had lovely light coming through the door size windows. For the price, this was an excellent choice for a short stay. The location, close to Victoria Station, some theaters, and excellent neighborhood restaurants, was terrific. The room was immaculately clean, as was the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “No Fuss Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shedee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 days and was wary about the reviews we had seen on this site but it turned out to be a pleasant experience. Check in was smooth and the guy manning the reception was pleasant and helpful. We were lucky to get a room one floor below as there are no lifts in this building. The double room was pretty spacious alhtough the covers look pretty jaded but everything was clean and tidy. The bathroom was small but clean and everything was well maintained. Room cleaning was done daily and fresh towels, soap, shampoo, conditioner and hairdryer was provided. it's ideal for no-fuss travellers who wish to stay there only to sleep. The location was great for nearby restaurants and about a 9 minute walk to Victoria Station. Free breakfast was sufficient and service was pretty fast,. However, seats are limited so coming early would be beneficial. Overall, we found this hotel very convenient for the budget conscious.

Reviews.Title: “very basic, matches 2 stars maximum”
Reviews.Author: martan33
Reviews.Content: Do not expect too much from this accommodation. We read all those nice reviews, photos were not so bad as well and we decided to stay there for 2 nights. When making phone reservation, we were confirmed a double room in the fIrst floor for the price 99 GBP per night BB. Well, upon arrival it was the first surprise- receptionist dressed in clumsy clothes, looked like he would be a homeless person. We asked to check the room first and he was not realy fond of it. We were shown the room in the basement, no. 2, extremely small, with very dirty shower all black at the edges and with a feeling that this would be the worst accommodation ever. We asked for another room immediately and recepctionist wanted to charge us 10 pounds more for the room which was confirmed to us by phone. We did not accept this trick and got a room upstairs finaly. This room was a bit larger, no. 9, more clean, only blanket and walls were dirty. Furniture was very poor and old, but it seems the same for all the rooms in general. Breakfast is continental, only from 7.30-09.00 and breakfast room too small. We came to the breakfast room at 08.30 and there were already guests standing in front of the door watching the other people eating. We explained to the receptionist that we did not intend to make other people uncomfortable by watching them eating and that we would go back to our room and we asked him to call us when there would be enough space to have breakfast. This worked out just perfectly and receptionist, Mr. Hussein, was very kind. Next day we had an early morning departure and asked how they deal with the breakfast. From our previous experiences in all other hotels or guest houses they always leave something for the guests as prearranged or they bring some things or breakfast box into the room. Reply was that they normaly would not do it as breakfast was complimentary anyway- free of charge- so it was not neccessary to deal with it. We explained that breakfast was definitely part of the room price calculation, that we booked BB and that these days people would not get anything as free of charge. Finaly we agreed to leave something for us, but night receptionist did not know anything about this arrangement. In general- absolutely dissapointing accommodation, matching 1-2 stars, very basic, but acceptable in a way. If you could afford more, it is better to book Best Western Victoria Palace which is just few metres away from this hotel and more near to Victoria station. Usualy we stayed there, but this time they were fully booked, therefore we booked nearby hotel, but wrong one unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Central Hotel with Good Value”
Reviews.Author: prodigyy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Victor Hotel for 7 nights on January. The location of the hotel is perfect. Just 8-10 minutes walking distance to underground, coach station and railway. It is a classic 3 star hotel (no lift) which is clean and in good condition. Adam is a very helpful and friendly guy who can give any information you would like. The room and bathroom size is good when you compare the price range. 24 hours reception service and free wi-fi internet access are the good services too. The only thing you should know, you need to make all the payment upon your arrival even it is 1 am :) They do not allow to you to go to bed and pay the next morning. Finally, if you do not have big expectations for the hotel (as we use the hotel for sleeping, rest of the day we will visit lovely London), it is going to be a good choise for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: davenlorraine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Victor with my wife for a theatre break and just wanted cheap, no frills accommodation for a couple of nights. The Victor was ideal as it was within walking distance of the coach and rail stations as well as Victoria theatres and restaurants. No need for taxis as the area is quite safe for walking and everything is available close by. The room was compact but very clean and well maintained and far better than some B&B hotels we have stayed at in other cities, particularly for the price. While the Victor does not do a full English breakfast the continental was plenty for us and there are plenty of options in the area if you want to eat out. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, making suggestions as to places we might want to visit or eat at. As infrequent visitors to London this was very useful. There is a great little pub around the corner run by a young couple who make visitors very welcome. We were both very pleased with our stay and intend to stay there again in the New Year on another theatre break.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly front desk staff, decent/good location”
Reviews.Author: MyTime4Traveling
Reviews.Content: The biggest comment I have is not necessarily about the hotel but about the odd street layout. Belgrave Rd switches names with other roads every few blocks, so for someone new to the area it was very confusing walking to the hotel from Victoria Station because I wasn't quite sure I was headed in the right direction. But after a couple walks, and some better directions, it was fine. Now, I like to walk so this review may not be consistent with your style but being in the Victoria area it was no big deal getting to places like Buckingham Palace and the Parliament area. BTW... DO read about the ALTERNATE Changing of the Guards area. When I went there it was a very manageable, small crowd and I could see everything just fine... good photo ops with the guards at the gate as well! Anyway... Westminster Abbey is also walkable, and if you're up for it, all the way to Trafalgar Sq, the Theatre District, Shakespeare's Globe (the tour is also worth the time)etc... Oh and if you are going to take a STONEHENGE Tour, be sure to go with a company like Anderson Tours that will get you right face-to-face with the stones before opening hours. Read descriptions carefully since many other companies don't specify that you won't get beyond the fenced in area... Anderson was well worth the extra money (and early rising time!) I'd consider staying at the Victor Hotel again. If you found this listing, you're ahead of the game since it doesn't show up as a first choice in many searches. But that doesn't mean it's not a decent option. No frills, no elevator... but a nice, friendly staff... a Continental Breakfast to get you on your way in the morning... Just remember to leave your key with the front desk on the way out :-) Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerfull”
Reviews.Author: sowingdebbie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights. If you are limited in mobility this is not the hotel for you as they have stairs everywhere and have no lift our room was on the fourth floor alot of stairs. The Breakfast is basic, i,e, toast croissant and cereal. Its clean but definitely a basic hotel and for the price you could definitely do better. The location is okay about five minutes walk from Victoria station so its easy enough to get around. Personally I would shop around before I stayed in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: writerGenoa_Italy
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel located very close to Pimlico Metro stop and close to Victoria Station. Corteous service, good breakfast and room and bathroom were clean and well appointed for the rate paid. Definitely worth every penny--we'll return to the Victor on our next trip to London. We've sent friends and relatives there and they were quite pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Big things comes in Small packages and Victor Hotel surely fits that description.....”
Reviews.Author: sami2681
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a great Location in London. Having heard so many complaints about London Hotels, I went expecting the worst case scenerio. Surprisingly it was much more than what I had expected. The rooms were a substanial size for at least two people to fit (having said that I was travelling alone) and the staff were friendly and helpful at all times. Breakfast was provided which I believe could have been better but if you feel that it is not up to your standards than you can always take a quick stroll down the street towards the nearest Cafe. Victoria Station was 10min walk away which was great since it was a Central point for all trains and buses. Someone once said big things comes in Small packages and Victor Hotel surely fits into that description even though its a 3 Star Hotel. If your wondering if I would go back there to stay, than the answer is Yes without a doubt...

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, but you can do better”
Reviews.Author: KatyerFin
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for its location and the reviews it had. Luckily we stayed here only for a night. The location is pretty good, walking distance to many places. There are restaurants and pubs nearby. Our check-in was quick and easy. The reception was very helpful and kind. Our room was behind the reception and we could hear everything that was said in the reception, even during the night. The room looked really nasty and would seriously need some refurbishing. Although I think it was somewhat clean. All in all the room was ok expect the noice from the reception and the horrible bed. It kept a squeaky noice every time you moved in it and sank into the floor. The breakfast room was one thing that I didn't like because there were only few tables. I felt that we had to eat really quickly to give some room for other people.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic European Hotel”
Reviews.Author: erink_pgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in late September 2010. Location and value were great, and the staff is friendly. Good coffee at breakfast (which is included), and free wireless Internet. The hotel is almost halfway between the Victoria and Pimlico tube stations. The room was clean enough - not the super-sterile environment you get with a US hotel, but comfortable. The walls in the room were quite scuffed up and the carpet and could use replacement, but the room was bright and airy with a French door window that looked out onto the street. Despite the bus stop outside I didn't notice much noise (we closed the window at night). The bathroom looked quite newly remodeled and was clean and large. The shower is about 2.5 feet square so it might be uncomfortable if you're a large person, but it was fine for us. There is no air conditioner, and I couldn't find a way to turn the radiator on, but the temperature was comfortable enough while we were there. There's a small TV that worked fine. As other reviewers have mentioned, there's no elevator. We had a room up one flight of stairs, also the breakfast room is below ground floor so there are stairs involved there too. The room is small but not too claustrophobic. Also there's only one wardrobe to unpack into, so be prepared to live out of your suitcase if you have a lot of stuff. One other tip, make sure you have the address of the hotel with you when you show up - it's on a long street of identical buildings with identical doors and they're almost all hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean fairly convenient hotel, needing a little tlc.”
Reviews.Author: VinceLun
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here during the papal visit; booked through 'Laterooms' at quite a discount it was good value for a bed and breakfast deal. The hotel is easily found, a good 10 minutes walk from Victoria, a helpful map can be printed off from the hotel web site. A friendly member of the hotel staff manned reception; a good welcome and paperwork easily dealt with made the arrival pleasant and easy after a long day. The room (12) was small but clean; its decor was quite scruffy in places though and was in need of some 'tlc' to make it presentable again. The TV was limited in terms of channels and the remote was not working - not a major issue, but again it was something that could easily be put right. The bathroom was small with shower, basin and toilet; all were clean. Toiletries consisted of just a small bar of soap in the shower and on the hand basin - this would have been better individually wrapped; I always take my own shower gel so it wasn't an issue, one always likes to know that bar soap is wrapped, definitely fresh and unused. The bed was comfortable and a definite plus was the number of pillows! I am often disappointed at the wafer thin pillow allowance - but here there were two reasonable pillows per person; the bed was firm and comfortable. I cannot comment on breakfast as I went down twice at 20-minute intervals to find a small queue on both occasions - the dining area is too small for the hotel and cannot accommodate many guests at one time. I can sympathise on space, but as only toast, croissants and tea or coffee was offered, it was not really worth the wait, as I had to make tracks for the next event. Perhaps offering guests a continental style breakfast pack delivered to their rooms may be an option? Tea or coffee can be made with the facilities already provided; I'm sure some local croissants, yoghurt and juice could be sourced to make this a viable option. As I booked the room at a heavily discounted rate, I was happy with the deal and could overlook the failings mentioned; however, had I booked the room at full rate it would have been a disappointment. The hotel should look to make improvements to the decor and small touches like the toiletries - breakfast service must be improved. Would I stay again? At the same discounted rate - most probably; at the normal rate? Unlikely. However, the Victor functions well as a 3 star hotel in a popular area, with a little work it would fully deserve the three stars it holds.

Reviews.Title: “A basic hotel with everything you need”
Reviews.Author: NgfamilyHK
Reviews.Content: I just stayed there for one night and although basic, you have everything you need... coffee/tea maker, hairdryer, TV, internet access. The location is super if you need to travel to and from Victoria Station, which is just 5 minutes walk. The hotel is clean and the breakfast served although not of a great variety, is enough to last the whole morning. Remember to ask for the croissant which is the best I have ever eaten in London hotels. The only downside is the internet that wasn't too stable during my stay but not really a big problem. Room is small but clean. If you have heavy luggage, you'd better ask for a room on the lower floor because the stairs are really narrow and steep. There was traffic noise too but it didn't affect me much because I was too tired after a day out in London

Reviews.Title: “London at the palm of your hands”
Reviews.Author: Tango01
Reviews.Content: I was very much surprised with this humble but confortable hotel. Service is wonderful (as oppposed to mots hotels in Europe) and front desk is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is not really super yummy but it is okay enough to start your day. It is perfectly placed near all the most important touristic sites- I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hasta la Vista Victor!”
Reviews.Author: VivaPip-Leaver
Reviews.Content: A superbly located Hotel, clean rooms, brilliant, helpful staff and an eviable workout on the legs too, bless those stairs! There have been complaints about there being no lift, where do you put a lift in an establishment with such limited space? Limited space, which I think has been used to its' very best. It's excellent value for money, in an area that is great to come back to ater a day out in the big city. Clean rooms, excellent bathroom (I travel with shampoo so previous complaints about there being none go past me, if you want toiletries, go 4/5 star or buy some, there's a local Sainsburys just down the road, it's opposite the Preto restaurant which I also recommend!). I have also seen complaints on here about the breakfast room being too small, I disagree. There's only 22 rooms, some of which are singles. This was adequately reflected in the breakfast room. AND WHAT A BREAKAST! More than enough choice to keep you going for a while and so good to see fresh fruit available, along with a decent coffee, also offered were croissants, toast and cereals. I needed the stairs to work off some that breakfast! This morning I had my fill of fruit and croissants then walked the tiny distance back to Victoria to get home after a wonderful weekend. I'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “A CUT ABOVE THE HOTELS IN THE VICINITY”
Reviews.Author: PhileasJo
Reviews.Content: What a PLEASANT surprise! Quite a change from the local OVERPRICED dosshouses near Victoria. Recently refurbished; bathroom spick & span; nice breakfast room; lovely breakfast. EXCELLENT value for money. To be WARMLY recommended

Reviews.Title: “What a let down”
Reviews.Author: weddingtonduo
Reviews.Content: Date September 2008.We booked the hotel over the net which was fine. On arrival the staff was pleasant and helpful from then on it went down hill. The room was very small for a double the wardrobe only had one handle the window sills was dirty , no guest toiletries. At breakfast time only 6 tables so you had to wait at entrance or come back later hoping for a table. The night before checking out you are expected to pay up in advance and not on the day you check out. At night time the staff was not very polite and did not greet you smiles or a hello and was giving the feeling out that they could not be bothered with you as a guest which made us very uncomfortable.Will not be stopping there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Alison014
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in from June 7th to June 10th. The location was great, being a 10 minute walk from Victoria Station and Buckingham Palace. There was also a bus stop right outside the door which was great. The room was clean, the furniture was a little dated though. The bathroom seemed as if it had been newly renovated so it was very clean. The shower was a little on the small side however. Also, the hairdryer was located in the desk by the window and was bolted in, so you had to do your hair at the desk without a mirror. A minor inconvenience. The breakfast was just ok, with juice, cereal, toast and croissants. Good service though. All in all, good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast experience”
Reviews.Author: WeBeHappyTravelers
Reviews.Content: The room was clean with a spotless bathroom. Although small, it still had a table with chair & TV, and it was a quiet room in the back, which is what we requested. The big surprise was the included breakfast--served on linen and china and in a pretty room! Good coffee too. Remember to ask for brown bread if you want wheat. Yes, creaky floors and flights of stairs but great value and located close enough to Victoria Station. The clerk, Hussen, couldn't have been nicer and even let us check in early and leave our bags there on our last day. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for backpackers”
Reviews.Author: hcwalton1
Reviews.Content: Victor hotel is a bit of a mixed bag. Amazing central location and good price for central L. Rooms are clean enough but it's very basic, a bit below a bad travel lodge standard. I think the staff could really do with giving the walls a lick of paint and putting brighter lights in the room as it would make a huge difference. They could also splash out on some freeview boxes. It was fine for one night and resembled the price but just don't arrive expecting too much.

Reviews.Title: “not the best one”
Reviews.Author: bistvan
Reviews.Content: we spent three nights in the victor hotel. well, as some of you have informed the location is just perfect. yes, walking distance from the victoria station, so you can reach every famous places easily. but, everything else... ...i think i am not the pickiest man in the world, but i feel that i failed when i booked this hotel. the interior is really poor, both public spaces and rooms. it would not be a huge problem due to its price but dirtiness is unacceptable. and it was dirty. the room walls, the curtain. there was a huge tear on the chair's carpet. may you say it's not a big deal, because who want's to spend too much time in a hotel room in london, so finally who cares, but i think it's a shame. ok, at least the bed was clean. there was no shampoo and shower gel in the bathroom, just an oldschool soap. well, it's also surprised me. the breakfast was also very poor. cornflakes, some crispy stuff, butter, jam, apple and bananas. croissant or toast on request. and that was all... the breakfast is from 6:30 to 9:00. once we went down at 8:50 and the service stuff said that we should not even start our breakfast because we would not finish it till 9:00. well, up yours i said, and we went to have or breakfast somewhere else... well, that's all i can say about this hotel. i deffo would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here next time too !!”
Reviews.Author: LeapinLiz
Reviews.Content: Great location .. walking distance from Victoria Station. . . Victor Hotel was clean, very clean!! The continental breakfast was sufficient and the waitresses smiled and were pleasant. The Hotel rooms are small but who spends all day in their room when they're in London?? The staff were really helpful with any tourist info we enquired about and there is a bus right outside the front door. We arrived very early in the morning and they let us leave our luggage there so we could head off for a big day! Stairs - there isn't a lift so if you have problems with stairs this isnt for you. We were on the fourth floor so we made sure we had everything we needed for the day when we left each morning. Reception is 24 hours which is another plus!! Security was good! We stayed here for 3 nights and if I go back to London I will probably stay here again. For the price (as London prices go) we were very happy with everything about Victor Hotel. (they even had the little extras like a jug and tea and coffee, and soap in the bathroom)

Reviews.Title: “Unworthy for a special weekend”
Reviews.Author: KrisCub
Reviews.Content: Alright, so I went to London to celebrate my 21st birthday, last weekend. I booked the hotel combined with the Eurostar from Brussels for the price of 260 euro or about 180 pounds sterling, which I thought was already enough. My eyes fell on Victor Hotel as it looked nice in the pictures, and it was one of the hotels for a reasonable price. Yay, Expedia! Arriving at the hotel on the lovely Belgrave Road in Victoria, I was greeted by the manager and a trainee. Both managed very well to look at me with hollow expressions. Reminds me of some of my collegues at my hotel when they see tourists. I did the effort to pay 130 quid for their hotel, and all of them failed to even push out one smile for me all weekend. So I don't know where the other reviewers get their 'amazing friendliness' from. Came into my single room, and I was quite amazed. A tiny television, a miniature window, wallpaper loosening up on top of the walls, no electricity on most of the sockets and hot boiling water from the shower, even if you turn the temperature down. I saw prison cells in Belgium on tv the other day and they looked nicer than this room did. Not to dramatise, but it's really how I felt at that moment. Very unworthy of a 3 star hotel. So I changed to a double room for the second night and I had to pay the excessive extra charge of Â£30. The room was better though and at last I felt comfortable. But they had to make up too much for me to think back about this hotel and think it was even acceptable. Nota bene, the hotel does not have an elevator, and they have rooms as high as the fourth floor. So be young, don't be alone, and don't bring too much luggage. That's my survival plan for the Victor Hotel. 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: bnh
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Victor. Great location - only 15 minutes walk from Victoria Station, plenty of restaurants and shops in the area. The room was very small as are all London hotels, but clean and comfortable. The staff were always very friendly and helpful. We had a problem one evening with boiling hot water coming from the cold tap in the bathroom. When we mentioned it to the reception staff on our way out to dinner they were very apologetic and it was fixed by the time we returned a couple of hours later. Breakfast was cereal, toast, croissant, fresh fruit - basic but plentiful. Most of the rooms are up several flights of stairs so would not be suitable for some people. At 69GBP per night we were very satisfied and would definitely stay at the Victor Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good velue for money”
Reviews.Author: RAHIM
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and clean place to stay. Good locaction and ex service.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: charlotteFrance
Reviews.Content: Tried every kind of accommodation in London, from cheap B'nB to "expensive" hotels, was always disappointed. This time, everything was fine : very nice and smiling staff, quiet, comfortable, clean room and bathroom, not scandalously tiny as often the case in the area. Great location : bus stop right in front of the hotel, bus nÂ°24 direct to Westminster, Theatreland, Camden, lots of nice ethnic restaurants + shops in the neighbourhood. Will come back. Only drawback : they do not have a strictly no smoking policy. One night, I was really bothered by cigarette smoke from room nearby. It even started the fire alarm in the middle of the night, waking up the whole hotel. People should not be allowed to smoke in hotel rooms any more.

Reviews.Title: “More of the same”
Reviews.Author: 2manydogs
Reviews.Content: I always try to avoid repeating what other reviewers say, but this is pretty much unavoidable. It's a nice, clean, reasonably-priced hotel in a very pleasant neighborhood. Rooms are small and there are no drawers but good hanging space. I shared a twin room and we each had a rolling bag next to the bed. You do have to be good friends to live out of suitcases for any length of time, but we spent six nights and developed a rhythm that made us both comfortable. We do both travel a lot. Bathroom is clean with good water pressure and plenty of hot water. Very small shelf for cosmetics, etc. Breakfast is wholesome, nicely presented, and incredibly boring. We ate there every morning to save money and we enjoyed visiting with the staff, but the clientele is so varied that you often find yourself with no other guests who speak your language beyond smiles and nods. We always felt comfortable walking around the neighborhood and it became a joke about who would say first "I love this neighborhood" when we left the hotel. My young traveling companion is still complaining that she can't find a restaraunt like "Seafresh" back in San Francisco. One of my best afternoons in the neighborhood was when I decided I needed to do laundry and the lady who ran the laudromat sent me across the street to the pub to wait for my wash. Met up with some Australians who were doing their wash and we all caught up with the local gossip. Of course, the pint of local brew helped with the whole thing--my traveling companion says I took a significant nap after my laundry run. I highly recommend it. If you're accustomed to luxury, you won't be happy here. If you have a sense of humor and can climb some stairs, this is a good opportunity to experience London on holiday rather than as a tourist. Every staff member I met at the desk, in the breakfast room, or in my room was friendly and helpful. You usually meet a stinker in every stay, but we didn't have that experience here. The hotel is close to Victoria and Pimlico underground stations. I arrived at Heathrow, took the undergound to Victoria, and walked to the hotel. It cost me about 6 pounds total. My friend spent about 50 pounds on a taxi to take her from the airport to the hotel. It just depends on what's most important to you. We bought day tickets that gave us access to underground, bus, and light rail. We used the underground to get around during the day, but always used the 24 bus to come home at night. Sit up top--it takes you past all the tourist sights and drops you right at the front door of the hotel. If you buy Day tickets, be sure to check out the 2 for 1 deals. Our big saving was on the Tower of London. We were tired and thought we'd seen all the "old stuff" we could deal with on our last day in London, but we agree that this is something you shouldn't miss. It's humbling to know how much was contributed to our modern belief system.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for clean, lower priced, central location, this is it”
Reviews.Author: wtilford
Reviews.Content: I completed my second stay at the Victor this spring. We had a nice room in the front with a balcony. You will get 1. a nice view 2. street noise. Stay in back room if you want quiet. The beds are FIRM, but OK. The room is very clean, and so is the bathroom. The wireless was great. It is fast and free! I did not need an intenet cafe at all. i don't think they had a wired connection though. The hotel is on a bus route, and an easy walk to the tube, train, coach station at Victoria. You can also use the Pimlico station. We were able to walk easily to Buckingham Palace, and in the other direction to the Tate Britan Museum. They have a fairly good breakfast available, but I skipped it. I went three blocks over and hung out at Cafe Nero. Starbucks is across the street if you require it. There are many small restaraunts nearby. Read Rick Steve's London Westminster review of the area for details on food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Victor Hotel was just fine for us!”
Reviews.Author: 2travellingdukies
Reviews.Content: We read some concerning reviews on this hotel, but we found it to be just fine for a couple of nights in London. It's very close (5-10 min walk) from Pimlico station and in a pretty safe area. The room (includes a TV) and ensuite bathroom were small but clean and more than enough for our needs. Breakfast is only a croissant, two slices of toast, coffee, and orange juice. We also had a small balcony overlooking the street but noise was not a problem - traffic died down pretty early. The hotel staff were nice and also kept our bags for us so that we could do some more sightseeing on our check-out day. For 65 pounds per night, you can't expect the Ritz, but we found the hotel to suit our needs just fine.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: fiona_1501
Reviews.Content: Second visit to hotel. Thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. Hotel was clean throughout. central to all ammenities. staff very friendly and helpful would definately visit again.

HotelInfo.Name: Victor Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 51 Belgrave Road, London SW1V 2BB, England
